body: @andris-sevcenko do you use defaults in urlManager?
@WinterSilence We have made several changes to UrlManager (https://github.com/craftcms/cms/blob/develop/src/web/UrlManager.php), but nothing I can think of that would impact controller param binding.

FWIW At [this point](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/ea60fba0aea97beade39c108568cb27a5b70aba7/framework/web/Controller.php#L130) I can see that `$params` contains the `$str` parameter, but not the other one and  I can see the code stepping in [this branch](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/ea60fba0aea97beade39c108568cb27a5b70aba7/framework/web/Controller.php#L182), which results in the default value (`5`) not being added to the `$args` array for the `$num` argument.

@WinterSilence I am not sure if that argument applies. If the action is run programmatically using `runAction('test/test', ['str' => 'test'])`, the behavior I expect would be that the default value of the `$num` parameter is honored, as it was before the commit referenced in this issue.

The explanation given in [the comment](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/commit/ea60fba0aea97beade39c108568cb27a5b70aba7#commitcomment-57170520) is absolutely right. I've made a mistake here and this needs to be fixed - I guess all you have to do is to extract [this part](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/base/Controller.php#L566) and put it back in [here](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/web/Controller.php#L180).
@bizley and this changes must have backside effect: when we generate links(`UrlManager`) to actions with default values of parameters we must merge they to defaults

issue.title: Fix bug with binding default action parameters for controllers
